intro: Discopleura laciniata, commonly known as the laceleaf strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its strikingly ornate, lace-like leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple, arranged in dense clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates with high humidity and well-drained soil. Due to its unique foliage and floral display, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in botanical gardens.
